title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: John M. Huff to J. H. Hall, June 14, 1868
summary: Huff, the Justice of the Peace in Churchville, details what he knows about a dispute between a Mary Minor and a Mr. Coleman. He describes Minor's personal situation, as well as her demeanor, characterizing her as a woman "of high temper."
keywords: Community Values/Local Behavior, Legal System, Family, Slavery, Violence/Crime, Women, American Civil War
